name: Virtuallinks
tagline: A Python simulator of file system links.
body:
Virtuallinks
============

> Why can't file system links occur without being registered on the file system?

```python
import virtuallinks
virtuallinks.link('on/a/dir/far/far/away', name='far_away_dir')
with open('far_away_dir/file.txt', 'w') as f:
    f.write('hello world!')
```

*virtuallinks* simulates at least one link, without changing the file system.

Install it with:

```bash
$ pip install virtuallinks
```

If you have any questions, then lets [chat](https://gitter.im/ffunenga/virtuallinks).

Pure Python code, 2 and 3 compatible.
